timeline.bodyText: I needed to add this MockBean to a lot of tests after adding it to the WorkspaceServiceImpl constructor.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Maybe for later, but if you find bundles of dependencies that are frequently needed together, you can make a stand-alone test configuration class with them and import that.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: nit: you should be able to omit the return statement.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: What happens if it's not found? Do we want  the delete method to throw an exception, or just return success (i.e. be idempotent)?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: no - this requires a return value
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Have you thought through the transactionality of errors here? If we succeed in deleting the workspace, but fail to delete the project, are we happy?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
Yes - that would be equivalent to the current behavior.  We will always be in a world where we need to go back and clean up orphaned projects (due to local DB wipes) so this is acceptable.
I'll update this to catch-and-log errors
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Does this immediately expunge the GCP project, or does it get put into a queue for deletion? There's no wrong answer, as long as everyone understands the behavior.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Also, is there a ticket for a simple cron to find orphaned billing projects?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
Immediate deletion.
We currently have a "Garbage Collection" cron for orphaned billing projects, but we should revisit this process.  I have a plan to do this, but it's not in JIRA yet
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Does this behave the same for user-provided billing projects and free tier billing projects/accounts? Do we need to update spend totals before killing it?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: We will always own the whole lifecycle for billing projects - users will bring billing accounts in the future which we will assign to the already-existing projects.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: please add tests showing all the failure modes (exceptions) and their handling (if any).
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Mostly this is a passthrough, so there's not much to test.  I added a test for failed project deletion
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.message: Add new Firecloud endpoint for Project Deletion
Delete billing project after deleting workspace
Move delete BP into a try/catch
